title: Build Your Own Git
description: Learn about git objects, plumbing commands, and more.
overview: This guide walks you through the internals of Git, focusing on understanding its fundamental components, such as Git objects, trees, and commits. You'll learn about plumbing commands and how they interact with these objects to build your own basic version of Git. By the end of this project, you'll have a deep understanding of how Git works under the hood.

sections.title: Introduction to Git Internals
sections.firstMessage:
In this section, we'll explore what makes Git tick. Here's what you'll learn:
1. Git's architecture
2. What are Git objects?
3. Introduction to hashing and SHA-1

sections.title: Building Git Objects
sections.firstMessage:
In this section, we will create Git objects step by step. Lessons include:
1. Creating blobs
2. Building trees
3. Constructing commits

sections.title: Working with Plumbing Commands
sections.firstMessage:
This section covers Git's low-level commands. You'll learn:
1. git hash-object
2. git cat-file
3. git update-index

sections.title: Creating Your Basic Git
sections.firstMessage:
This section will guide you in combining everything you've learned to create a basic Git clone. Lessons:
1. Combining objects
2. Building a minimal Git command-line tool

lessons.title: Building a Basic Git Command-Line Tool
